Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with adequate water and light to show it growing well.
The student can draw a plant without water and light to show it not growing well.
The student can include visual details in their drawing that show differences between the conditions, such as drooping leaves or different colors, to represent patterns observed in nature.
The student can depict a scene showing that plants need water to live and grow, using arrows or labels.
The student can depict a scene showing that plants need light to live and grow, using arrows or labels.
The student can use simple symbols or colors to differentiate between plants getting enough water and light versus those that are not.
